snippet: Sandy Alderson, the Mets general manager, said signing David Wright and R. A. Dickey to contract extensions would be the organization’s top priority this winter.
abstract: New York Mets defeat Miami Marlins, 4-2, on the final day of a disappointing regular season; Mets general manager Sandy Alderson says signing third baseman David Wright and pitcher R A Dickey to contract extensions will be the organization’s top priority this winter.
lead_paragraph: Sandy Alderson, the Mets general manager, said signing David Wright and R. A. Dickey to contract extensions would be the organization’s top priority this winter.

headline.seo: Mets Are Headed in the Right Direction, Alderson Says
headline.main: Alderson Says Money Is an Object to the Mets
headline.print_headline: Alderson Says Money Is an Object To the Mets
